words.defineEn: to declare something true or to be the case according to facts
words.defineVi: để tuyên bố một cái gì đó đúng hoặc là trường hợp theo sự thật

examples: I suppose it's being adjudicated now whether it's genocide.
Given this problem, we might expect the courts to help correct them by accurately adjudicating guilt and innocence.
Otherwise, we’re all just believing whatever we want, with no grounds for adjudicating between beliefs.
Well, the ostensible reason, the one they're saying, is that they detected electoral fraud that was not being adjudicated properly.
And, Senator, in connection with the commanders' ability to punish alleged perpetrators, you did introduce eight years ago legislation creating a new channel for adjudicating sexual assault.
words.defineEn: bring to an end; settle conclusively
words.defineVi: Kết thúc; giải quyết dứt điểm

examples: I should know by now not to put such vile treachery past the likes of him.

Beginning in Limbo, he travels through the circles of Lust, Gluttony, Greed, Wrath, Heresy, Violence, and Fraud, to the horrific ninth circle of Treachery, where sinners are trapped under the watchful eyes of Satan himself.
Well, there's only one form of punishment fit for this kind of treachery.
words.defineVi: sự phản bội của một niềm tin

examples: The journey alone is treacherous.
Hurricanes bring high winds and treacherous rainfall.
All treacherous places to wander even without the alluring glow of the Will-o’-the-Wisp leading you deeper into danger.
They begin a treacherous odyssey, a migration back to the pond in which they were born.
Like the Berezovka mammoth and Lyuba, many mammoths’ lives were claimed by the treacherous landscape of the tundra.
words.defineVi: nguy hiểm không ổn định và không thể đoán trước

examples: Furthermore, Levesque says the plant produces 80 percent less waste and requires less uranium enrichment, allaying proliferation concerns.
Chewing on a clove can help alleviate a toothache.
When I'm feeling stressed or overwhelmed, I try to remember that patience is a plaster for all sores, and that taking a step back and giving myself time can help to alleviate my anxiety.
IN THE LATE '90s, HE HAD BEGUN TAKING VICODIN, AT FIRST TO ALLEVIATE SYMPTOMS FROM MIGRAINES, DEPRESSION AND ANXIETY.
She's founded an international children's rights organization, the Lumos Foundation, as well as the Volant Charitable Trust to alleviate social deprivation across Scotland.
Moving elections to weekends or holidays could help alleviate some of these issues.
words.defineEn: to help ease mental or physical pain
words.defineVi: để giúp xoa dịu nỗi đau tinh thần hoặc thể chất

examples: With the signing of the treaty, a powerful new European alliance first saw the light of day.
In politics, it's often true that the enemy of your enemy is your friend, and we see strange alliances formed for short-term gain.

The politician made a point of showing respect and kindness to his opponents, believing that it is good to make a bridge of gold to a flying enemy, and that treating people well could help him build alliances and get things done.
He wanted an alliance.
We witnessed an alliance between an elected head of state and a violent extremist organization on full display.
words.defineEn: an association between countries, organizations, political parties, etc. in order to achieve common interests
words.defineVi: sự liên kết giữa các quốc gia, tổ chức, đảng phái chính trị, v.v. nhằm đạt được lợi ích chung

examples: We should not give preferential treatment to one element to the detriment of the others.
He puts all his time into his career, to the detriment of his personal life.
Cancellations are a detriment to the host's bottom line.
But this downturn is not just a detriment to Pride events.
So our economy will be less globalized to all our detriment.
It's really detrimental to all of the economy and to all workplaces.
Can be detrimental to us in the future.
He's seen the detrimental effects of these high interest rates firsthand.
For instance, a ban on H-1B will likely have a detrimental impact on the tech sector that relies heavily on foreign talent.
I will reverse Trump's detrimental asylum policies, raise our target for refugees.
words.defineEn: (sometimes followed by `to') causing harm or injury
words.defineVi: (đôi khi được theo sau bởi `to') gây hại hoặc thương tích

examples: This blend of chemicals, minerals, and intergalactic particles settles out of the air onto surfaces in our homes, mixing with the detritus of each house’s occupants.

It also protects surrounding cells from damage since some viruses spread by rupturing their host cells, which can lead to large-scale destruction, the build-up of detritus, and potentially even organ damage.
words.defineEn: the remains of something that has been destroyed or broken up
words.defineVi: phần còn lại của một cái gì đó đã bị phá hủy hoặc chia tay

words.defineEn: the principles and methods of instruction
words.defineVi: các nguyên tắc và phương pháp giảng dạy
một người giáo dục những người trẻ tuổi

examples: And there are some companies that are enterprising in sort of absorbing that money and doing stuff for that money, and they have no scruples about what they do.
words.defineEn: an ethical or moral principle that inhibits action
words.defineVi: một nguyên tắc đạo đức hoặc đạo đức ngăn cản hành động

examples: There are, of course, less scrupulous means of getting books into people’s hands.
He is a man of scrupulous honesty and integrity.
And number four: Is overconscientious scrupulous, and inflexible about matters of morality, ethics, or values.
And they have another scrupulous solution for staying put.
words.defineEn: having scruples; arising from a sense of right and wrong; principled
words.defineVi: đắn đo; phát sinh từ ý thức đúng sai; có nguyên tắc

examples: Haste trips over its own heels, as the saying goes.
The driver knew that anger and haste hinder good counsel when he was cut off in traffic.
The chef reminded the kitchen staff that haste makes waste, urging them to take their time and be careful in their food preparation to avoid costly mistakes and wasted ingredients.
I was in a rush to get to work and ended up spilling coffee on my shirt, proving once again that more haste, less speed.
The project manager reminded the team that cutting corners would only lead to delays and complications, saying that 'fool's haste is no speed' and urging them to follow established procedures.
words.defineVi: tốc độ quá háo hức (và có thể bất cẩn)

examples: Immediately, the king hastened to the riverbank.
Outside of the markets, the current wave of litigation against oil and gas companies could also hasten a shift in both public perception and policy.
His research hastened the evolution of 20th century experimental psychology from pure behaviorism into what we now know as social-cognitive learning.
As did predictions that it would hasten the demise of the coal industry.
I do think that one of the initial reports of the caravan in the spring of 2018 does hasten the announcement of zero tolerance.
Voluntary Services offered equine therapy and yoga as in-home services.
Equine therapy can even help people boost self-esteem or cope with social stress.
Another, similar study tried equine therapy with 19 kids and compared them to a control group of 15 who were on a waitlist.
Some people also report that equine therapy is a great option for ASD children.
With the help of these adaptations, equines like Merychippus were able to grow larger than forest-dwelling horses, reaching up to 450 kilograms.

words.defineEn: of or relating to or featuring horseback riding
words.defineVi: của, liên quan đến hoặc có tính năng cưỡi ngựa
